Name: SVAYAMBHU C
Title: Satkhanda Dec 2022
Review: We marvelled at the iconic watch tower, the Satkhanda, which was supposed to be 7 stories but ended up being 4 because of the untimely death of the nabab. The tallest clock tower of the country was also nearby.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Incomplete tower
Review: This iconic tower has an octagonal base, arched windows & Islamic design details. Conceived as a 7 storied structure, it could only be completed till the 4th level, as the Nawab's family saw a few deaths during the construction and this was conceived as bringing ill omen to the family. A nice picture spot though.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Tower of Seven Storeys
Review: Commissioned by Nawab Mohammad Ali Shah, this was actually intended to be a 7 Storeyed Watch-tower.... unfortunately, due to the untimely death of the Nawab, the construction of this tower got stalled and did not go beyond 4 levels.... the structure incorporates subtleties of Greek designing whilst the arches depict Mughal & French craftsmanship.... the unique architectural feature of this 68 ft tower is that every successive level has been built in the decreasing order of height & breadth of it's base floor

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Landmark
Review: The place is located  near clock tower and visible also from Rumi Darwaza  but is in decay  and cannot be missed from the areas around .

Name: ShikshaC
Title: An eye catching monument.…
Review: The Satkhanda is located just near the Clock tower and cannot be missed if you are visiting the tower or Rumi Darwaza. This is an incomplete structure as its construction was stopped after the death of the Nawab’s daughter for whom he was building this place.

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Watchtower from the 1800s
Review: The Satkhanda was a watchtower built in the 1800s. The iconic tower has an octagonal base, arched windows & Islamic design details. It is located next to the Husainabad Clock Tower; so, if you're in the area, you can't miss it.A reminder of Lucknow's Avadhi & colonial past.

Name: kushBans
Title: Good sight !!
Review: This place is close to bara imambara. But this tank is not well maintained as compared to the remaining other structures.

Name: FATBOY
Title: SATKHANDA- Indian leaning Tower of peesa
Review: Satkhanda is a watchtower near Bara Imambara and Rumi Darwaza, Lucknow. Though it name means Seven Floors but it only has four red-brick floors. It's construction was undone due to the sudden demise of Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah. This vintage watchtower reminds you of French architecture. In all nice place to visit for history seekers.

Name: infojonny
Title: Satkanda
Review: The Satkanda is not much to see but it is the old structure which is made in the nawab time but nice to visit

Name: _adhikarigautam10
Title: satkhanda lucknow..
Review: its attraction is just because it is nearer to imambara picture gallery and clock tower ..more of the lucknowrs dont no abot the satkhanda ..so not so good ..but the goverment making lots of efforts to re make its charm as old time.

Name: FahadK61814
Title: Good to Know.
Review: Good to see our Indian History & culture. Dream project of the Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah, but the building was never took its shape as planned. History Behind the Building.

Name: qahead123
Title: nice place
Review: THis looks like leaning tower of pica n Colosseum of Rome. it provides a great view to the history of Lucknow.

Name: GingerBeer1979
Title: Much more interesting than you might at first think.
Review: This tank is much more interesting than you might at first think... defiantly accept (after the usual haggling) the services of a guide... he will show you the darker parts of the semi defensive structure, which you might not find on your own (especially without a torch!) A tour will take about 20 minutes.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Good building near Roomi gate
Review: Must see this building. Its just in the corner of Roomi gate. You can see this building from Bara Imambara

Name: Fahim_Khan_13
Title: History Behind the Building
Review: Visited the place while in Lucknow, If you go to Bada Imambara, there are auto people who take 40 rs. & show you another 4 attractions in which 1 is this, other 3 will be clock tower, chota imambara & romi darwaza. Also they take you to big shops which do chikan embroidery work, so they will show you how they make it & than will try to sell some clothes to you.Coming back to the building as Auto Person told, this was used to see the Moon of Ramzan & Eid & likewise.Good Trip for historical monuments, mostly all monuments nearby in this area.

Name: Manish B
Title: Condition is deteriorating day by day
Review: This building was the dream project of the Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah, but the building was never took its shape as planned. Was originally planned to build 7 story building to see the moon but due to death of the nawab the project is closed. The building is very important piece of indian history but its getting worse day bay day.

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Nice Building
Review: Satkhanda, built in 1842 by Nawab Mohammad Ali Shah, is a decaying 67 meter red-brick watchtower, located just opposite to the Hussainabad Imambara. It is a splendor of medieval architecture and is visited by a number of tourists from all over the world.The tower shows a blend of French and Italian style structural designs. It was constructed during the time of Nawab Muhamad Ali Shah, but his untimely demise in 1840 blocked its construction. Though the towering structure is named as Satkhanda, which means seven stories, it holds only four stories. Famed as the tallest tower in India, Satkhanda, is believed to be built in the 1880s in memory of Sir George Couper, a reform-minded Governor of UP.

Name: guddu1954
Title: old glory restored
Review: This used to be a seven storeyed structure but now only four storeys are there.Till few years back it was in a very bad condition but now after extensive restoration old glory has come back.

Name: uutsav
Title: Looks like leaning Tower of Pisa from far
Review: This tower is near to Husainabad Clock Tower and the Bada Imambada. It was supposed to have 7 stories but only has 4 completed ones. According to Wiki, it was build during 1837-1842 during the time of Muhammad Ali Shah, but was left incompleted after Shah's untimely demise.Since the tower is next to the road, it won't take more than a few minutes even if one plans to halt for a while.
